title: Old jockey gym: quirky Footscray house near Flemington for sale
text:
A mid-century marvel rich in horse racing history has trotted onto the market in Footscray.

The retro property at 17 Smith Cres has been kept in near-original condition since it was used as a jockey training gym.

It’s now off and racing, for sale with a $1.3-$1.4 million price guide.

With Flemington Racecourse just a walk away, competing riders would stay at the three-bedroom property before taking to the track.

A spa, sauna, sweat box and floatation tank are all still in working order inside the ground floor bathroom.

It’s next to a gym that was used as a weights room.

Katrina Watson, who is selling the property on behalf of her deceased parents, said it’s understood the previous owner was a jockey trainer.

“Jockeys would shed off their last few kilos in the sauna and sweat box because competing,” Ms Watson said.

“Mum and dad lived there for about 25 years and kept all the details.”

She said that “1970s bling”, including tiger print wallpaper in the bedroom, funky pendant lights and a bar, had been retained over the years. Other unusual wallpaper remains in the living areas.

The modernist gem boasts views through expansive first floor windows to Flemington Racecourse, the city and neighbouring parkland.

Biggin & Scott Yarraville agent Tristan Tomasino said the property had been “impeccably maintained” and would appeal to families and investors.

“The downstairs floor could even be converted into a self-contained unit and perfect for an Airbnb,” Mr Tomasino said.

“You can’t find a better location than this in the inner west.”

He added the Western Hospital redevelopment underway just 400m from the property would boost demand for the suburb in years to come.

Other features of the home include a vaulted timber entry, central kitchen with a copper rangehood and wine fridge space, and a sunroom with an adjoining balcony.

The property is scheduled to go under the hammer on Emirates Stakes Day, November 9.
